TopicDetails.title: property crime
TopicDetails.callTitle: Call for proposals on cooperation on property crimes
TopicDetails.description:
Scope:

The call for proposals will fund activities aiming at boosting the operational activities of law enforcement authorities with regard to the mobile nature of organised criminal groups in relation to organised property crime and other criminal markets, including synergies between them.
TopicDetails.conditions:
1.   Eligible countries:

All EU Member States, with the exception of Denmark, as well as the following third countries: Albania, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Kosovo, Moldova, Montenegro, Republic of North Macedonia, Serbia, Turkey, Ukraine, Algeria, Bahrain, Djibouti, Egypt, Iran, Iraq, Israel, Jordan, Kuwait, Lebanon, Libya, Malta, Morocco, Oman, Qatar, Saudi Arabia, Syria, Tunisia, United Araba Emirates, Palestine and Yemen.

International organisations can be established outside the above-mentioned countries.

United Kingdom is not bound by Regulation (EU) No. 513/2014 establishing the ISF Police instrument and its implementing decisions and UK entities are therefore not eligible to participate under this call.

 

2.   Eligibility and admissibility conditions: see section 5 of the call document.      

 

3.   Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement: see section 3 of the call document.

 

4.   Proposal templates and model grant agreements (MGA):

Guide for applicants

Standard proposal template

Multi-beneficiary Model Grant Agreement

 

Members of consortium are required to conclude a consortium agreement, in principle prior to the signature of the grant agreement.

5.   Additional documents:

Call document

ISF-P Annual Work Programme 2020

ISF-P legal basis: Regulation (EU) No 513/2014 and Regulation (EU) No 514/2014

EU Financial Regulation
TopicDetails.supportInfo:
Contact the HOME-ISF@ec.europa.eu for further assistance related to content of the call and topics.

F&T Portal FAQ – Submission of proposals.

IT Helpdesk – contact the IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

H2020 Online Manual - Please use the manual with caution and only for the Participant Portal tools guidance, i.e. Submission service and Beneficiary register. It is H2020 specific and does not cover the ISFP rules. Some aspects of these funds are different from the provisions of the H2020 programme.
TopicDetails.sepTemplate:
To access the Electronic Submission Service, please click on the submission-button next to the type of action that corresponds to your proposal. You will then be asked to confirm your choice of the type of action and topic, as these cannot be changed in the submission system. Upon confirmation, you will be linked to the correct entry point.

To access existing draft proposals for this topic, please login to the Funding & Tenders Portal and select the My Proposals page of the My Area section.
